1.text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, to the saints which are at Ephesus, and to the faithful in Christ Jesus:

2.text: Grace be to you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

3.text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ:

4.text: According as he has chosen us in him before the foundation of the world, that we should be holy and without blame before him in love:

5.text: Having predestinated us to the adoption of children by Jesus Christ to himself, according to the good pleasure of his will,

6.text: To the praise of the glory of his grace, wherein he has made us accepted in the beloved.

7.text: In whom we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of sins, according to the riches of his grace;

8.text: Wherein he has abounded toward us in all wisdom and prudence;

9.text: Having made known to us the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure which he has purposed in himself:

10.text: That in the dispensation of the fullness of times he might gather together in one all things in Christ, both which are in heaven, and which are on earth; even in him:

11.text: In whom also we have obtained an inheritance, being predestinated according to the purpose of him who works all things after the counsel of his own will:

12.text: That we should be to the praise of his glory, who first trusted in Christ.

13.text: In whom you also trusted, after that you heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation: in whom also after that you believed, you were sealed with that holy Spirit of promise,

14.text: Which is the earnest of our inheritance until the redemption of the purchased possession, to the praise of his glory.

15.text: Why I also, after I heard of your faith in the Lord Jesus, and love to all the saints,

16.text: Cease not to give thanks for you, making mention of you in my prayers;

17.text: That the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give to you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of him:

18.text: The eyes of your understanding being enlightened; that you may know what is the hope of his calling, and what the riches of the glory of his inheritance in the saints,

19.text: And what is the exceeding greatness of his power to us-ward who believe, according to the working of his mighty power,

20.text: Which he worked in Christ, when he raised him from the dead, and set him at his own right hand in the heavenly places,

21.text: Far above all principality, and power, and might, and dominion, and every name that is named, not only in this world, but also in that which is to come:

22.text: And has put all things under his feet, and gave him to be the head over all things to the church,

23.text: Which is his body, the fullness of him that fills all in all.
